info.game_comments:
Matt Jackson game 5.

WE ASKED: Quarterback Aaron Rodgers.

(2, 1).clue: In 2015 this QB gave the truck he won as MVP to Malcolm Butler, the rookie who made the game-saving interception

(3, 1).clue: To set a fair valuation of a property for a transaction, turn to a certified residential this professional

(4, 1).clue: With the power of a million tornadoes, it's a description that overstates reality for effect

(5, 1).clue: Both blue-faced boobies & blue-footed boobies nest in these Ecuadorian islands

(6, 1).clue: Happy baby, in which you lie on your back with your knees to your chest & hold your feet, is a pose in this

(3, 2).clue: Cash, investments & physical goods are all these, from the Latin for "enough"

(4, 2).clue: In math it indicates the number of times an expression is multiplied by itself

(5, 2).clue: The smallest species of this bird, the fairy or little blue, nests in burrows, not in the ice & snow

(6, 2).clue: He had a way with words, enumerating our unalienable rights as "Life, Liberty and the pursuit of Happiness"

(2, 3).clue: (I'm Aaron Rodgers of the Green Bay Packers.)  I'm one of the first 2 Packer QBs to be Super Bowl MVP; this 2-time winner who later coached the team is the other

(4, 3).clue: A concentrated substance used in chemistry or cooking

(6, 3).clue: The song "Happy" says, "Clap along if you feel like a room without" this

(3, 4).clue: Often used in mutual funds, it's the strategy of investing broadly across a number of investments to reduce risk

(4, 4).clue: Like a foot or a hand, it's a part of something that is the farthest from the main part

(5, 4).clue: As well as the great blue, there is a little blue type of this long-legged wading bird

(6, 4).clue: A book by him is called "Happiness Is a Warm Puppy"

(4, 5).clue: Someone who deliberately behaves in an extravagant way to attract attention

(1, 1).clue: It's a symbol of the all-american way of life

(2, 1).clue: On January 20, 1801 he was nominated to be Chief Justice, a job he would retain for the next 34 years

(3, 1).clue: Mount Kita-Dake, Japan's second-highest peak, is almost 2,000 feet lower than this top mountain

(4, 1).clue: Maurice Allais got a 1988 Nobel in this for work in "the theory of markets and efficient utilization of resources"

(5, 1).clue: Yes, Sir!  Among this British composer's awards & honors are 7 Tonys, 7 Oliviers & a life peerage

(1, 2).clue: What baby needs, according to craps players
